text: Gaston Neal (1934 - October 21, 1999) was an American poet and activist. He was from Pittsburgh. He won a Mayorâ€™s Award for Excellence in Literary Arts. He co-founded the New School for Afro-American Thought. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America == References == == Other websites == * * Gaston Neal: 100 Years of Black Writing anacostia.si.edu/ Category:1934 births Category:1999 deaths Category:American poets Category:American activists Category:Writers from Pittsburgh Category:African-American people
